Kali::

Kali laughed more"That non agression pact doesn't exit" replied the 
femme with a smile"My old brother, Shivah, is most interested to 
rescue our leader Darkfate than annoy maximals... if those 
Infecticons wouldn't have captured him, we would be... Annoying you.  
I don't like start a fight here 'cause I'm courious to know what 
reasons have the maximals to act as they act... What did you expected 
to win with the rescue of your friend?... just answer me this 
question and I'll leave this place... and swear me by your maximal 
honor that you and your little friend never said that we have a 
small, friendly and pacific chat..."


--- In nbwrpg@y..., HanaKirei85@a... wrote:
> <<> AzureBlade: I do not recall that North America is Predacon 
Territory, 
> > and it isn't Maximal territory either. Neutral Terrain remains 
such. 
> > If you were mentionning my earlier venture near your base, then I 
> > would have to say that I am a Maximal, and that I consider 
helping my 
> > brethrens as my duty. And bravery, my esteemed Kali, is not 
difficult 
> > to find. Would you dare to stand up to your leaders because of 
what 
> > you think?>>
> 
> North America...so then that was their location. Neutral Terrain to 
boot. 
> That meant Kali wouldn't dare to try an attack out here...would 
she? Or would 
> she defy her leaders? In any case, despite her beast form being 
partially 
> bat, Mistra would be glad to be free of this cave...and of any 
possible 
> conflict at the current time. When she changed...or maybe not...her 
> activation code, things would be different of course.
> 
> > 
> > <<He looked at her intensely. She read open defiance, and he knew 
it. He 
> > just wished she could let them go. Besides, Prowl had told him 
about 
> > the non-agression pact. That could be the key.
> > 
> > AzureBlade: As for my friend Mistra, I believe she has already 
chosen. 
> > I will also refresh your memory, if you allow. Maximals and 
Predacons 
> > have agreed to non agression, right? If you do not let us go 
safely, 
> > this could mean war. Think, and you shall see you clearly do not 
want 
> > a war. Now step aside.>>
> 
> Mistra was confused...but things were looking up. So...the Maximals 
and 
> Predacons had agreed to non-agression then. She just hoped Kali 
would listen 
> to Azure's words and move to aside for them to leave. Oddly 
enough...Kali 
> hadn't seemed to do more than glance at her before her full 
attention was on 
> Azure. Perhaps because he looked more daunting to the Predacon as 
he was than 
> she did. It made sense, come to think of it...or perhaps because 
she was as 
> of yet, still new to this planet and its conflicts. Or just the 
fact she'd 
> already chosen her side, and Kali didn't see any point in trying to 
change 
> her mind. Whatever the reason, Mistra was glad Azure had taken 
charge in this 
> situation.
